basic_info.name: Ahmed Bahloul
basic_info.description:
I'm Ahmed Bahloul. Im a versatile Full Stack Developer with 2+ years of hands-on experience in web and mobile development, data extraction, and AI-powered workflows. Backed by an engineering degree and a licenciate in computer science, I blend strong technical fundamentals with creative problem-solving.
Ive delivered end-to-end solutions as a full-stack web developer, leveraging modern frameworks and toolsincluding AI assistants like GitHub Copilotto boost productivity and code quality. Whether building responsive interfaces, designing scalable backends, or automating data pipelines, Im dedicated to exceeding client expectations and turning ideas into impactful digital experiences.
Lets collaborate and create something exceptional!

projects.title: Catch me if you can
projects.description: Catch Me If You Can is a fast-paced browser game where players click on a fleeing emoji that moves unpredictably. The game gets harder as the emoji speeds up, with challenges like shrinking, decoys, and obstacles. Featuring vibrant visuals, playful sounds, and a scoring system, its fun for all ages. The game is still in v1 though.

projects.title: Agil ERP
projects.description: I designed and developed a custom ERP web application for the lubricants distribution department at AGIL, based on direct collaboration and requirements gathering with key stakeholders. The application centralizes and streamlines the management of clients, leads, products, packaging, supply chain activities, and users. It was specifically built to simplify day-to-day operations for diverse user profiles including sales personnel, storekeepers, and administrators, providing each with tailored functionalities to improve efficiency and coordination within the department.

projects.title: Valo energy
projects.description: I designed and developed a web application that allows the evaluation of energy-related funding requests for an investment bank. The system provides automatic scoring across various criteria, taking into account the specificities of different energy-related projects. It simplifies and structures the evaluation process for business experts and investment representatives, helping them make informed decisions more efficiently. From a technical perspective, the project was particularly valuable as it was built using a microservices architecture and integrated data from publicly available government APIs.
